issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A patch for this issue has been uploaded to JIRA by a contributor.
status.name: Patch Available

fields.description:
Bucketized Table feature fails in some cases. if src & destination is bucketed on same key, and if actual data in the src is not bucketed (because data got loaded using LOAD DATA LOCAL INPATH ) then the data won't be bucketed while writing to destination.
Example
----------------------------------------------------------------------
CREATE TABLE P1(key STRING, val STRING)
CLUSTERED BY (key) SORTED BY (key) INTO 2 BUCKETS STORED AS TEXTFILE;
LOAD DATA LOCAL INPATH '/Users/jp/apache-hive1/data/files/P1.txt' INTO TABLE P1;
â€“ perform an insert to make sure there are 2 files
INSERT OVERWRITE TABLE P1 select key, val from P1;
--------------------------------------------------
This is not a regression. This has never worked.
This got only discovered due to Hadoop2 changes.
In Hadoop1, in local mode, number of reducers will always be 1, regardless of what is requested by app. Hadoop2 now honors the number of reducer setting in local mode (by spawning threads).
Long term solution seems to be to prevent load data for bucketed table.
fields.summary: Bucketized Table feature fails in some cases

comments.body: BucketingSortingReduceSinkOptimizer removes RS op if src & destination is bucketed on same key.
Dupe of HIVE-3077 / HIVE-3244 ?
temporary patch, need to update q files.

ATTACHMENT ID: 12734942 - PreCommit-HIVE-TRUNK-Build
[~jpullokkaran], the test failure is unrelated and I think the patch is ready to go. Thanks.
address [~jpullokkaran], [~xuefuz]'s comments.

[~pxiong], Looking at the latest patch, I don't think this is adequate to prevent user getting corrupted data due to previously mentioned non-interactive clients. Even if you log an warning message, it doesn't help because data corruption may have already happened.

I think we should disallow user to do "insert into" a bucketed table, as I articulated on RB. This will cover all types of clients.

[~xuefuz], thanks for your comments. If you read the comments from [~jpullokkaran] in the review board, you will find out that this patch is targeting "load into" a bucketed table rather than "insert into" a bucketed table.

Thanks for the explanation, [~pxiong]. However, even if it's only for "load into", the problem I described still remains, right? Interactive users might see a warning message, but those using JDBC or thrift API will not.

[~xuefuz], Yes, the problem still remains. If you read my comment on RB this morning, you will find that "And after we discussed with Hive JDBC guy, we found that current infrastructure does not support warning msg to be passed through JDBC. We acknowledge that this is something that we need to improve in the future."
Yeah. I saw that, but I was wondering why we cannot disable it or make it harder for users to make such a mistake. A warning, even being seen, is already too late, right?
[~xuefuz], we agree with you but that will be a major change and should be done only as part of a major release.

I don't quite understand either the major change or the major release you're referring to, but I guess my points didn't get thru. Now the concern is, when people find that this JIRA is "fixed" in the future, they won't know that it actually doesn't mean much. Nevertheless, thanks for your contribution.

ATTACHMENT ID: 12736207 - PreCommit-HIVE-TRUNK-Build

reassign to [~hsubramaniyan]. Here is what we are expecting in a new patch after discussing: (1) Remove the enforce bucketing and the enforce sorting flags. (2) For insert into a bucketized table, get the table property if it is a bucketized one (sort by some key) and do the correct insert  (3) For load into a bucketized table, always throw an exception. (4) update all the related q files. (5) add a backward compatibility flag to allow to go back to the previous usage.
[~pxiong], could you explain how to do step (2), will you or [~hsubramaniyan] fix HIVE-3608: Support appends (INSERT INTO) for bucketed tables? Thanks
[~ychena], yes, it would be the best if insert into is also supported. That depends on how far [~hsubramaniyan] would like to go. Thanks.
